articles.title: Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Kangdong Precision Machine Plant
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Kangdong Precision Machine Plant
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, gave field guidance to the Kangdong Precision Machine Plant.
					 He looked round the room for the education in the revolutionary history of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He said that the plant developed into a model one relying on its own efforts under the wise guidance of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He said he examined new-type precision machine products on the spot, adding they were excellent ones. Noting the plant successfully carried out the task Kim Jong Il assigned to it in the last period of his life, Kim Jong Un said Kim Jong Il would have been very pleased if he had seen the Korean-style machine product characteristic of the plant.
					
					 He underscored the need to spruce up the room for the education in the revolutionary history and bring the undying leadership feats of the great Generalissimos home to its employees so that they may steadfastly carry forward the tradition of the plant in which it had devotedly carried out any task set forth by the Generalissimos.
					
					 After watching the monument to the field guidance of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Un underlined the need to erect well such monuments at the units associated with leadership feats of the Generalissimos. He gave an important instruction to do so.
					
					 After watching precision machine products made at the plant, he said they look nice and are convenient for use and very high in their performance.
					
					 Going round different shops, he learned about production and modernization there.
					
					 At the processing shop he learned that workers are operating numerically controlled milling machines and other CNC-based equipment manufactured by their own efforts and with indigenous technology. He once again highly appreciated their revolutionary spirit of self-reliance.
					
					 Going round the assembling shop, he watched with keen attention the assembling of products. Paying deep attention to working environment, he indicated an orientation and ways to improve it.
					
					 After learning about the performance of precision machines, he told workers to make a good performance note. 
					
					 He learnt about the production of daily necessities.
					
					 Looking at umbrellas, door-knobs, hair-clippers, etc. he said that it is necessary for the plant to fulfill its plan for the production of not only precision machines but daily necessities without fail.
					
					 The plant has an important role to play in developing the nation's machine-building industry, he noted, setting forth tasks to be fulfilled by the plant.
					
					 Noting that the plant should honor its production plan for this year without fail and wage a dynamic drive to boost the production of precision machines, he set the goal to be attained by the plant in a few years to come.
					
					 Noting that the plant could improve the performance and quality of its precision machines as it put the processing equipment on a CNC-basis, he emphasized that it should realize the modernization of equipment at a higher level in order to increase the production of machines and ensure their precision.
					
					 In order to make precision machines prove efficient in practice, it is necessary to wage a dynamic technological innovation drive for ensuring the reliability of products and making them light.
					
					 He had a photo session with the workers of the plant.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Hwang Pyong So and Hong Yong Chil.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae Makes Field Surveys of Major Projects in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae Makes Field Surveys of Major Projects in Pyongyang
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Choe Ryong Hae, director of the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army, made field survey of construction sites of the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, the cemetery of fallen fighters of the KPA and apartment houses for scientists.
					 Going round various places of the construction sites close to their completion, he encouraged soldier-builders.
					
					 He underscored the need to ensure speed and quality of structures.
					
					 He also learned about the construction of apartment houses for scientists.
					
					 He stressed the need to build apartment houses for scientists to be impeccable in the distant future. He took measures to dynamically conduct frontline-style agitation activities and substantially provide materials needed for construction.

articles.title: DPRK Foreign Minister Speaks at Ministerial Meeting of Asian Regional Forum
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Minister Speaks at Ministerial Meeting of Asian Regional Forum
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, head of the DPRK delegation, made a speech at the  ministerial meeting of the 20th ASEAN Regional Forum held in Darussalam of Brunei on Tuesday.
					 He referred to the fact that the DPRK has further reenergized the country's overall economy and achieved successes in the improvement of the people's standard of living by stepping up the building of a thriving nation under the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He reiterated the DPRK's will to bolster up its capabilities for national defence and, at the same time,  exert efforts for developing the economy and improving people's standard of living for the purpose of making sustained efforts for peaceful development.
					
					 Referring to the repeated vicious cycle of confrontation and escalated tensions and the touch-and-go situation prevailing on the Korean peninsula due to the U.S., he said:
					
					 The U.S. aims to disarm the DPRK and bring down its social system by employing all means and methods.
					
					 It also seeks to further reinforce its military deployment to contain other countries by massively introducing latest war equipment into the Asia-Pacific region under the pretext of the "threat" from the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. is still trumpeting about "provocation" and "threat" from the DPRK, which reminds one of a guilty party filing the suit first. All facts go to prove that the real provocateur and main culprit of acute tensions is none other than the U.S.
					
					 Such unceasing vicious cycle of acute tensions on the peninsula is attributable to the deeply-rooted hostile policy of the U.S. toward the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. has not recognized the sovereignty of the DPRK but pursued all sorts of sanctions, pressure and military provocation against it for more than half a century since it designated the DPRK as enemy from the very day of its founding for the mere reason that it has differing ideology and social system.
					
					 It is impossible to settle the nuclear issue on the peninsula and any other matters and the vicious cycle of tensions will persist nonstop unless the U.S. rolls back its hostile policy toward the DPRK and defuses its nuclear threat to the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. drop of its hostile policy should start from the conclusion of a peace treaty between the U.S. and the DPRK on the basis of the respect for the latter's sovereignty and halt to all sanctions and military provocations against it.
					
					 This year marks the 60th anniversary of the Korean Armistice Agreement.
					
					 We once again call for an immediate dismantlement of the "UN Command" which has existed so far by abusing the name of the UN as a leftover of the Korean War.
					
					 Consistent is our stand to put an end to the tensions on the peninsula through dialogue and negotiations and to contribute to the regional peace and security.
					
					 Recently the DPRK proposed high-level talks between the authorities of the DPRK and the U.S. to have sincere discussions on wide-ranging issues including defusing military tensions on the peninsula, replacing the Armistice Agreement by a peace mechanism and "building a world without nuclear weapons" touted by the U.S.
					
					 Now that the international community is expressing serious concern over the tense situation on the peninsula, if the U.S. truly wants detente, it should respond to the bold decision and goodwill of the DPRK without any precondition.
					
					 Proceeding from its invariable stand for independent reunification of the country and peace and prosperity of the nation, the DPRK will make responsible and patient efforts to implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 The DPRK foreign minister expressed belief that the member states of the forum would extend support and solidarity to the sincere efforts of the DPRK to end the vicious cycle of tensions and achieve durable peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The DPRK government will as ever make every effort to boost the friendly and cooperative relations with the regional countries, guided by the idea of its foreign policy -- independence, peace and friendship -- and protect peace and security in the region including the peninsula, he stressed.

articles.title: DPRK Military Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Military Delegation Back Home
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- A DPRK military delegation led by Kim Kyok Sik, chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, returned home on Wednesday after wrapping up its visit to Cuba.
					 It was greeted at the airport by Jang Jong Nam, minister of the People's Armed Forces, KPA Lieut. Gen.   Ryom Chol Song, KPA Col. Gen. O Kum Chol and other KPA generals and officers, and Juan Miguel Garcia Montano, military attache of the Cuban embassy here.

articles.title: Mongolian Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Mongolian Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Information Technology, Posts and Communications Authority of Mongolia led by Chairman Tsagaan-Uvgun Jadambaa visited Mangyongdae, birthplace of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 They went round the historical relics preserved with care, being briefed on the revolutionary life of the President and his patriotic and revolutionary family.
					
					 The chairman said: I deem it honor to visit the native house of President Kim Il Sung. I was deeply moved to see so many people visiting Mangyongdae.
					
					 The delegation also toured the Tower of the Juche Idea, e-library of Kim Chaek University of Technology, Korean Computer Centre and other places.

articles.title: Agreement on Exchange, Cooperation in IT Signed between DPRK, Mongolia
articles.content:
Agreement on Exchange, Cooperation in IT Signed between DPRK, Mongolia
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- An agreement on exchange and cooperation in the field of IT was signed here on Wednesday between the governments of the DPRK and Mongolia.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Kang Yong Jun, general director of the State General Bureau of Software Industry, and other officials concerned and from the Mongolian side members of the visiting delegation of the Information Technology, Posts and Communications Authority of Mongolia led by Chairman Tsagaan-Uvgun Jadambaa and Mongolian Ambassador to the DPRK Manibadrakh Ganbold and staff members of his embassy.

articles.title: Ho Chi Minh Class Created at Kyongsang Kindergarten
articles.content:
Ho Chi Minh Class Created at Kyongsang Kindergarten
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- A ceremony for naming the Ho Chi Minh class was held at the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Kyongsang Kindergarten on Wednesday. 
					 Present there were Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the committee who doubles as chairman of the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Association, officials concerned, teachers of the kindergarten, Vietnamese Ambassador to the DPRK  Le Quang Ba and his embassy officials.
					
					 Earlier, the Vietnamese embassy officials laid a floral basket before an art work depicting the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu among children at the central hall and paid tribute.
					
					 At the ceremony, speakers said that the Ho Chi Minh class was named at the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Kyongsang Kindergarten on the occasion of the 56th anniversary of the meeting between President Kim Il Sung and President Ho Chi Minh.
					
					 They hoped that the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations would grow stronger under the deep care of the leaders of the two countries.
					
					 Then, the participants looked round the Ho Chi Minh class and the room dedicated to the history of the kindergarten. They also enjoyed an art performance given by children and talked with each other.

articles.title: DPRK Hit by Downpour
articles.content:
DPRK Hit by Downpour
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Downpour swept through most parts of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea on Tuesday, with more than 100 mm rainfalls registered in some areas.
					 From 00:00 to 21:00, it rained 198 mm in Songwon County, 195 mm in Tongsin County, 175 mm in Sinuiju City and Phangyo County, 172 mm in Singye County, 170 mm in Jongju City, 164 mm in Unsan County, 162 mm in Uiju County and 161 mm in Kwaksan County. 
					
					 From 06:00 to 09:00, 97 mm rainfall was witnessed in Jongju City and Singye County, 88 mm in Ryongchon County, 85 mm in Kwaksan County, 82 mm in Hamju County, 80 mm in Sinuiju City, 75 mm in Tongsin County and 66 mm in Songwon County.
					
					 Heavy rainfall was interwoven with wind of 10 odd meters per second in some areas in Nampho City and North and South Hwanghae and Phyongan provinces.
					
					 The rainy storm caused 70 cm-high waves in the sea off Haeju City, Jamae and Sinmi islets and the West Sea Barrage.

articles.title: U.S. Remains Unchanged in Bid for Nuclear War on Korean Peninsula: News Analyst
articles.content:
U.S. Remains Unchanged in Bid for Nuclear War on Korean Peninsula: News Analyst
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Sixty years has passed since the Korean War (June 1950-July 1953), but the Korean Peninsula is still exposed to a danger of nuclear war due to the U.S. persistent moves against the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 After working out a secret nuclear war plan "8-53" in November 1953, the United States has made a series of amendments of it, posing a constant threat to the DPRK.
					
					 It mapped out "120-day war scenario", "OPLAN 5027" and "OPLAN 5027-98" in the latter half of the 1990s, "OPLAN 5030", "OPLAN 8022-02" in the 2000s and "OPLAN 5029", "Tailored Deterrence Strategy" and "Plan for Jointly Countering the Provocation of a Local War" in recent years. All of those plans were made for simultaneous nuclear attack at the DPRK on the ground and in the sea and air.
					
					 In accordance with the plans, the U.S. has carried on nuclear war exercises as an annual event, with "Team Spirit" U.S-s. Korea joint war drill starting in 1976.
					
					 This year's "Key Resolve" and "Foal Eagle" were the height of the joint military exercises against the DPRK.
					
					 Involved in them were nuclear carrier strike group, strategic bombers, Aegis destroyers, ground, naval and aerial strike means, along with huge U.S. and south Korean puppet forces.
					
					 The facts go to prove that the U.S. is scheming to unleash another war on the Korean Peninsula on all accounts.

articles.title: Society for Rallying Comrades, First Party Organization in Korea
articles.content:
Society for Rallying Comrades, First Party Organization in Korea
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung in his teens formed a party organization called the Society for Rallying Comrades, thus paving a way for building a Juche-based revolutionary party.
					 He declared its formation at a meeting held in Kalun on July 3, Juche 19 (1930).
					
					 The name of the organization represented his will to make revolution with comrades who would share the life and death with him under any circumstances.
					
					 The society served as a parent body for building a party by means of forming grassroots organizations and expanding them.
					
					 Thanks to his guidance and energetic activities, a party organization was founded in the homeland with Onsong area as the centre while a number of grassroots party organizations appeared in armed groups and in east Manchuria and northern border areas along the Tuman River in a short span of time after the meeting.
					
					 Afterwards, a party committee was formed in the Korean People's Revolutionary Army, which gave leadership over party organizations at all levels.
					
					 Thus, Kim Il Sung established his leadership system over the Korean people's anti-Japanese struggle as a whole.
					
					 On the basis of such experience, he founded the Workers' Party of Korea in less than two months after the country's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule.

articles.title: U.S., West's Arms Sale Denounced by Minju Joson
articles.content:
U.S., West's Arms Sale Denounced by Minju Joson
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The U.S. defense security cooperation agency requested Congress to allow the sale of 274 medium-range air to air missiles, 530 direct hit missiles and 780 laser-guided bombs that are mountable on F-35 to south Korea, according to foreign media reports.
					 To keep up with it, the western munitions companies have been engaged in munitions sales contract with south Korea, and a German company is mulling selling 170 air-to-ground missiles worth 300 million U.S. dollars to south Korea.
					
					 The facts bring to light the real purpose of the U.S. and the West that have deliberately screwed up the tensions on the Korean Peninsula over the DPRK's nuclear issue.
					
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes this in a bylined commentary.
					
					 One of the major purposes is to line their pockets with cash, the news analyst says, and goes on:
					
					 The Korean Peninsula has become the world's most dangerous hotspot where an accidental case may lead to a war as huge armed forces stand in acute confrontation.
					
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. and its followers provide south Korea with war hardware. This, in essence, shows that they seek to bring a war to the peninsula by escalating inter-Korean confrontation and disturbing peace.
					
					 It is very ridiculous for the U.S. to talk about "provocation" from others and "deterrence".
					
					 The U.S. should discontinue at once the dangerous move of pushing the situation on the peninsula to the extremes.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts Outbursts of S. Korean Puppet Minister of Unification
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts Outbursts of S. Korean Puppet Minister of Unification 
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Ryu Kil Jae, puppet minister of Unification of south Korea, when interviewed by reporters in charge of covering the ministry on June 28 let loose a spate of rigmaroles that he did his "best to fulfill his duty" and "he would strongly react to the north if it fails to properly respond to his message," talking about "dialogue".
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is no more than a cynical ploy to tone down the domestic and international criticism of the puppet group's acts of blocking the inter-Korean dialogue and evade the responsibility for the present tensions on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 With no rhetoric can the south Korean authorities cover up their despicable act of escalating the confrontation with compatriots in collusion with outside forces going against the trend toward the improved inter-Korean relations, peace and reunification.
					
					 If they are sincerely interested in the dialogue and improved relations between the north and the south, they should drop their hypocritical attitude and take a sincere stand of working for peace and reunification together with compatriots.
					
					 They should pay heed to the voices of the nation calling for improved inter-Korean relations.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Intensifying Anti-Imperialist, Anti-U.S. Class Education
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Intensifying Anti-Imperialist, Anti-U.S. Class Education 
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Wednesday editorially calls for dynamically conducting class education under the uplifted banner of anti-imperialist and anti-U.S. struggle in order to further consolidate the socialist revolutionary position, the class position.
					 It says:
					
					 The Korean revolutionary ranks at present are made up mainly of those who have neither experienced exploitation and oppression nor undergone stern trials of war.
					
					 If the class education of those generations is neglected even for a moment, as they know what a war is like only by reading novels or watching films, their anti-imperialist and class consciousness will gradually wane and the history of the struggles for winning a victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War remain a past thing.
					
					 Succession to revolution means succession to ideology and spirit.
					
					 Only when the generation, who bravely fought the severe war, and the present younger generation struggle in the same spirit as displayed in the battle on the River Rakdong, can the Korean revolutionary ranks grow to be invincible ranks unshaken in any storm and stress and can society of the DPRK prove to be an impregnable fortress which no hostile class can dare infiltrate into.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet regime are now going reckless in the moves to pressurize and stifle the DPRK politically, militarily and economically, hurt its dignified system and destabilize its society by mobilizing all sorts of conspiratorial organizations.
					
					 One should not lay down a weapon of the revolution and the working class even for a moment in the on-going general advance and the targets of the class struggle remain unchanged as the revolution advances.
					
					 No matter how much water may flow under the bridge and no matter how frequently old generations are alternated, the Korean revolution should not allow any attempt to slacken or weaken the class education, concludes the editorial.

articles.title: Why Does U.S. Attaches So Great Importance to Okinawa
articles.content:
Why Does U.S. Attaches So Great Importance to Okinawa
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is massively deploying its forces in Okinawa as it regards the island as the most important outpost for carrying out its pivot to Asia-Pacific strategy, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a bylined article.
					 There are in the Asia-Pacific region not a few potential rivals of the U.S., the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is the view of U.S. strategists that Washington's victory of its world strategy hinges on how to establish its control over the Asia-Pacific region. It is the viewpoint of U.S. policy-makers that if it is to put Asia under its control, it should grab the whole of Korea and only then is it possible for the U.S. to realize its world strategy with ease.
					
					 Regarding it as a main link in the chain efforts to carry out its Asia-Pacific strategy to put the Korean Peninsula under its control, the U.S. imperialists seek to invade the DPRK by force of arms, occupy the whole of Korea and, furthermore, dominate Asia and the rest of the world. But the U.S. is seriously mistaken.
					
					 The U.S. base on Okinawa is exposed to any strike.
					
					 Its neighboring powers are following Okinawa with heightened vigilance as the U.S. pursues a sinister aim to ward off their impact, contain the expansion of the sphere of their influence and realize its wild ambition for world domination at any cost.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to give up a foolish daydream and behave itself.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Brands U.S., S. Korea as Provoker of Korean War
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Brands U.S., S. Korea as Provoker of Korean War 
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and south Korean puppet authorities launched anti-DPRK campaign on the occasion of June 25, day of the start of the Korean War, to publicize the story of "invasion of the south" by the DPRK. However, they can not cover up their bellicose nature as they ignited the Korean War in the 1950s and have been hell-bent on the military provocations against the DPRK, being obsessed with the ambition for invasion of it after the war. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article. 
					
					 The last Korean War was an inevitable product of the U.S. brigandish policy for aggression of Korea, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 After the Second World War the U.S. militarily occupied south Korea to dominate the whole Korean Peninsula and the rest of Asia. Bolstering up the armed forces of south Korea, the U.S. instigated south Korea to kick up the reckless racket of the "northward advance".
					
					 Even after the ceasefire, the U.S. stayed in south Korea to block the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and disturb peace and stability of the Korean Peninsula, while bringing about dark clouds of a nuclear war. 
					
					 The U.S. and south Korea have so far massively hurled armed forces for aggression into the Korean Peninsula and frantically resorted to the joint military exercises against the DPRK, vociferating about "invasion of the south". 
					
					 Their noisy story about "invasion of the south" and "provocations by the north" on the occasion of June 25 only brings to light their wicked true colors as provoker of the Korean War and disturber of peace.

articles.title: S. Korean Society Cursed by People
articles.content:
S. Korean Society Cursed by People 
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- An increasing number of people curse the south Korean society due to the widening gap between the rich and the poor. 
					 The results of the recent opinion poll conducted by a media organization of south Korea among more than 2 000 people from all walks of life across it said more than half of the respondents answered they would like leave it.
					
					 Explaining the reason, they noted south Korea is ridden with ever-widening gap between the rich and the poor and scandals committed by "government" ministers, lawmakers and other privileged. 
					
					 This shows the real picture of south Korean society under the unpopular rule of the conservative forces. Special benefits and privilege are granted to big businessmen and the rich while the toiling masses are subject to exploitation and oppression.

articles.title: More Student Organizations in S. Korea Publish Declarations on Situation
articles.content:
More Student Organizations in S. Korea Publish Declarations on Situation 
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The students associations of the senior high schools of south Korea gathered near Kwanghwamun in Seoul on June 29 to make public a joint declaration on the situation in protest against the puppet Intelligence Service's interference in the election. They were from Kanghwa County of Inchon City, Kumsan County of South Chungchong Province, Jechon City of North Chungchong Province and Sanchong County of South Kyongsang Province.
					 The declaration accused the IS of deliberately misleading people to support the specified candidate during the "presidential election" in south Korea last year.
					
					 Such crime was disclosed long ago but the ruling party has worked hard to cover up the IS's interference in the election, shutting its eyes to this, the declaration noted, adding that the party went the lengths of opening to public even the minutes of the 2007 south-north summit.
					
					 It declared that now is the time to root out the IS's ceaseless interference in political affairs.
					
					 The declaration demanded the IS and the "president" make an official apology to the people for the case.

articles.title: Magazine Thongil Issued
articles.content:
Magazine Thongil Issued
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The International United Confederation of Koreans released the June issue of Thongil, its monthly socio-political magazine.
					 The magazine gave an account of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un's inspection of Unit 1017 of the Air and Anti-Air Force of the Korean People's Army, illustrated with photos showing his guidance of a flight drill of the unit.
					
					 It also carried news of his on-the-spot guidance to the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex, accompanied by his photos.
					
					 Seen in it is a photo of the monument inscribed with the great Generalissimo Kim Il Sung's signature erected in Panmunjom under the title "Monument reflecting nation's desire" on the occasion of the 13th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration. It carried an article saying that the joint declaration is a programme, a new landmark for reunifying the country under the banner of "By our nation itself".
					
					 The magazine contained the crucial statement issued by the spokesman for the National Defence Commission of the DPRK proposing high-level talks between the authorities of the DPRK and the U.S., the statement released by  the spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea laying bare the true nature of the south Korean authorities which aborted the talks between authorities of the north and the south and reports issued by  Russian media on the  recent situation on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 It gave an account of a seminar held by Russian experts on Korean affairs on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 It also dealt with news of Russia and international news.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Carried by Canadian Newspaper
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Carried by Canadian Newspaper
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's work "The Organizational and Ideological Consolidation of the Party Is the Basis for Our Victory" was carried by the Canadian newspaper TML Weekly No. 24.
					 The work published on December 15, Juche 41 (1952) deals with the nature and tasks of the Korean revolution and clarifies necessity and tasks to strengthen the ideological work of the Workers' Party of Korea since the Fourth Plenary Meeting of the Central Committee of the WPK.
					
					 The newspaper carried a photo of the President.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle for National Reunification Supported in Britain
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle for National Reunification Supported in Britain
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on June 20 issued a joint statement on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The U.S., boss of imperialism and chieftain of world reaction, ignited a war against the young DPRK by instigating the south Korean puppet forces on June 25, 1950.
					
					 The Korean people waged a hard-fought Fatherland Liberation War against the U.S. imperialists and their followers under the outstanding leadership of President Kim Il Sung, invincible and iron-willed commander and brilliant military strategist.
					
					 They turned out as one in the national liberation struggle against the U.S. imperialist aggressors, a just war to protect the freedom and independence and a sacred struggle to reunify the country.
					
					 The Korean War proved the great vitality of the Songun idea.
					
					 We vehemently denounce the monstrous massacres committed by the U.S. imperialists during the Korean War.
					
					 History will always curse the U.S. imperialists as barbarians, criminals, enemy of mankind and progress and the chieftain of aggression and war.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are committing all sorts of crimes, still occupying south Korea in disregard of the demands of the Korean people and world progressive people.
					
					 They are covering the upkeep for their forces with the money collected from the south Korean people as taxes and egging their puppet fascists onto moves for confrontation and a war against the DPRK.
					
					 We send full solidarity to the Korean people in their just struggle to drive the U.S. imperialists out of south Korea as early as possible under the outstanding leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists should roll back their hostile policy toward the DPRK and conclude a peace treaty with it.
					
					 We will firmly join hands with the followers of the Juche idea and the Songun idea around the world and struggle for defending the DPRK and driving the U.S. imperialists out of south Korea. -0-

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported by Personage of Regional Body
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported by Personage of Regional Body
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Marwan Sudah, chairman of the Arab Committee for Solidarity with Korean People and Supporting the Reunification of Korea, contributed an article titled "Tenacity of people's Korea"  to the Jordanian newspaper Al Diyar on June 12 and 13.
					 The U.S. moves for aggression against the DPRK is, undoubtedly, a violation of the Armistice Agreement concluded by both belligerent parties and an obvious and shameless provocation to Juche Korea, the author noted, and went on:
					
					 The DPRK strongly reacted to the recent U.S.-S. Korea joint military drills for aggression, thus checking and foiling the U.S. scenario to ignite a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. escalation of tensions on the Korean peninsula is aimed to block the development of the DPRK and inflict a war and poverty on its people.
					
					 The DPRK, however, has access to war deterrent including nukes to foil the aggressors' moves.
					
					 The DPRK will inflict a bitter defeat upon aggressors and throw enemies into a dumping ground of history.

articles.title: Organizations of Brazil, Nigeria Term U.S. Provoker of Korean War
articles.content:
Organizations of Brazil, Nigeria Term U.S. Provoker of Korean War
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Brazil and Nigeria posted articles on their websites on June 19 and 22 on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK in an article titled "Why did the U.S. ignite the Korean War?" said:
					
					 On June 25, 1950, the U.S. instigated the south Korean puppet army to start an all-out invasion of the DPRK, sparking the Korean War, the fiercest since the end of the Second World War.
					
					 Then why did the U.S. ignite the Korean War?
					
					 The first reason was to carry out its strategy for world domination.
					
					 The U.S. regarded Korea as a military strategic vantage for advancing into the Asian continent. Considering the end of the Second World War as a good opportunity, its forces landed in south Korea under the mask of "liberator".
					
					 For the U.S. the Korean Peninsula was a strategic vantage from which it could make a military strike at any region of the Far East, a "bridgehead" for advancing into the continent for world domination and it was like a "dagger" for cutting off "a big piece of meat" like Asia.
					
					 The second reason was to tide over its catastrophic economic crisis.
					
					 The U.S. needed a chance to weather the crisis and, accordingly, it had no other alternative but to ignite the Korean War.
					
					 The third reason was to save the Syngman Rhee fascist puppet regime in south Korea from a tight corner.
					
					 It was an irrefutable historical fact that the U.S. sought to secure a military strategic vantage for world domination and save itself and its followers from a tight corner through the Korean War.
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea also posted on its website an article disclosing the true colors of the U.S. as the provoker of the Korean War.

articles.title: World Public Censures U.S. for Provoking Korean War
articles.content:
World Public Censures U.S. for Provoking Korean War
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Newspapers and websites of various countries dedicated articles to the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle from June 20 to 25.
					 The Uruguayan newspaper La Juventud in its article titled "The U.S. invaded the DPRK on June 25, 1950 and how did the Korean War break out?" said:
					
					 The Korean War broke out on June 25, 1950 but it already started when the U.S. forces landed in south Korea.
					
					 With the defeat of Japan at hand, the U.S. hatched a plot to realize its strategy for dominating the Korean Peninsula, the scenario which had been in the making for centuries.
					
					 The newspaper cited facts to prove that the U.S. pushed forward its premeditated moves for a war against the DPRK after occupying south Korea. It went on:
					
					 Dulles flew into south Korea as a special envoy of Truman on June 17, 1950 and finally examined a plan for the Korean War. 
					
					 Similar articles were posted on websites of the Russian Group of Solidarity with the DPRK, the Rostov-Na-Donu Anti-Bourgeois Front and the Anti-Globalization Movement, internet magazine Mar 12 and internet TV Krasnoe Televidenie and the Ukrainian internet newspaper Obektivnaya Gazeta.

articles.title: Day of Korean People's Victory in War to Be Marked in Denmark
articles.content:
Day of Korean People's Victory in War to Be Marked in Denmark
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- A Danish joint preparatory committee to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War was inaugurated in Copenhagen on June 25 under the joint sponsorship of the Communist Party in Denmark and the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association.
					 A member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party in Denmark and Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, were elected co-chairmen of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful events on the occasion of the anniversary.

articles.title: Disbandment of "UN Command" Demanded in Indonesia
articles.content:
Disbandment of "UN Command" Demanded in Indonesia
						
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The Pioneer Party of Indonesia, the Soekarno Foundation for Education of Indonesia, Bungkarno University and the Indonesia-Korea Association for Friendship and Cultural Exchange issued an appeal on June 15 to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The appeal said:
					
					 This is a significant year marking the 60th anniversary of the heroic Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 The Korean Armistice Agreement (AA) was concluded on July 27, 1953.
					
					 Almost 60 years have passed since the ceasefire but the war has not yet been ended from a technical point of view.
					
					 Fragile state of armistice is still going on the Korean peninsula due to the lack of an institutional mechanism for guaranteeing peace and there is doubt about peace or war.
					
					 The U.S. is making a desperate bid to keep as ever the "UN Command," a ghost-like entity dating back to the Cold War, persistently shunning the DPRK's consistent stand and efforts to replace the AA with a peace treaty. 
					
					 This specter is reviving as a tool for a war of aggression bringing the dark clouds of war to the Asia-Pacific region, the world's biggest hotspot, according to the U.S. new defense strategy.
					
					 If the danger of war on the Korean peninsula is to be completely defused and durable peace to be ensured, it is necessary first of all for countries concerned to terminate their hostile relations. What is the most important to do so is for the U.S. to roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK and stop the nuclear war drills and dismantle the "UN Command", the legacy of the Cold War, and drive its aggressor troops out of south Korea at once.
					
					 We express full support for the DPRK's crucial measures to defend the sovereignty and dignity of the nation and the supreme interests of the country and appeal to the world peace-loving people to actively join the Korean people in their just struggle.

articles.title: Day of Korean People's Victory in War to Be Marked in Syria

Day of Korean People's Victory in War to Be Marked in Syria

articles.title: Raul Castro se reune con la delegacion militar de la RPDC
articles.content:
Raul Castro se reune con la delegacion militar de la RPDC
						
Pyongyang, 3 de julio (ACNC) -- Raul Castro Ruz, Primer Secretario del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Cuba y Presidente de los Consejos de Estado y de Ministros de la Republica de Cuba, se reunio el dia primero en el edificio del Consejo de Estado con la delegacion militar de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea encabezada por el jefe del Estado Mayor General del Ejercito Popular de Corea, Kim Kyok Sik, de visita en el pais caribeno.
					En la ocasion el mandatario cubano dijo que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Cuba y Corea se basan en las especiales relaciones fraternales entre el companero Fidel Castro Ruz y el companero Kim Il Sung.
					
					Subrayo que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il consolido aun mas las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises.
					
					Deseo que el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea logren mayores exitos en la revolucion y la construccion bajo la sabia direccion del companero Kim Jong Un.
					
					Al recordar que tuvo profunda impresion de su visita a Corea, expreso la voluntad de seguir fortaleciendo y desarrollando las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con Corea.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun denuncia arraigada politica anti-RPDC de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun denuncia arraigada politica anti-RPDC de EE.UU. 
						
Pyongyang, 3 de julio (ACNC) -- En la reunion ministerial del 20o Foro Regional de la Asociacion de Naciones del Sudeste Asiatico (ASEAN), efectuado el dia 2 en Darussalam, Brunei, el canciller Pak Ui Chun, jefe de la delegacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, pronuncio un discurso.
					Pak se refirio a que bajo la sabia guia del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, el pueblo coreano acelera con dinamismo la construccion de un Estado prospero, asi que se activa la economia nacional en su conjunto y se alcanzan notables exitos en el mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo y continuo: 
					
					La RPDC seguira librando con dinamismo la campana para el desarrollo pacifico fortaleciendo mas la capacidad de defensa nacional y concentrando las fuerzas en la construccion economica y la mejora de las condiciones de vida del pueblo.
					
					Debido a EE.UU. en la Peninsula Coreana repite la circulacion viciosa de confrontacion y la agravacion de la tension y perdura la grave crisis de guerra en visperas de estallarse.
					
					El imperio norteamericano persigue desarmar y derrocar a la RPDC valiendose de todos los metodos y medios e introducir en gran cantidad los armamentos sofisticados en la region de Asia-Pacifico so pretexto de la "amenaza" de la RPDC para perfeccionar su distribucion militar tendente a mantener a raya a otros paises. 
					
					EE.UU. sigue divulgando el rumor de "provocacion" y "amenaza" de la RPDC, lo que es un acto cinico igual a un incendiario que grita "!fuego!".
					
					Todos los hechos demuestran que el verdadero provocador y agravador de la tension es EE.UU.
					
					La circulacion viciosa de la incesante agravacion de la situacion en la Peninsula Coreana se debe a la politica norteamericana de hostilidad contra la RPDC. 
					
					EE.UU. la fijo como su enemigo desde el primer dia de su fundacion y no reconocio su soberania, mientras practica durante mas de medio siglo las sanciones de toda indole, la presion y las provocaciones militares contra esta.
					
					Mientras que existan la politica hostil y la amenaza nuclear de EE.UU. contra la RPDC, no se resolvera ningun problema inclusive el nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana y seguira la circulacion viciosa de la agravacion de la tension.
					
					La eliminacion de la politica hostil anti-RPDC de EE.UU. debe ser iniciada con la concertacion del convenio de paz entre los dos paises a base del respeto a la soberania de la RPDC y con el cese de las sanciones de toda indole y las provocaciones militares contra esta. 
					
					Este ano se cumple el 60o aniversario de la firma del Acuerdo de Armisticio de Corea.
					
					Urgimos otra vez a disolver sin demora la "comandancia de las fuerzas de la ONU", que existe todavia como residuo de la pasada guerra coreana abusando del nombre de la ONU. 
					
					Es invariable nuestra posicion de acabar con la tension de la Peninsula Coreana mediante el dialogo y negociaciones y contribuir a la paz y seguridad de la region. 
					
					Recientemente, propusimos hacer las conversaciones de alto nivel entre las autoridades RPDC-EE.UU. para discutir amplia y sinceramente varios temas, entre otros, el de alivio de la tension militar en la Peninsula Coreana, el de sustitucion del sistema de armisticio por el de paz, asi como el de "construccion del mundo libre de armas nucleares" presentado por EE.UU.
					
					En la actualidad en que la sociedad internacional expresa unanimemente una gran preocupacion por la situacion critica de la Peninsula Coreana, EE.UU. debe responder sin premisa a la decision y buena bondad de la RPDC, si desea de veras el alivio de la tension. 
					
					Partiendo de la invariable posicion por la reunificacion independiente de la patria y la paz y prosperidad de la nacion, haremos esfuerzos responsables y pacientes por ejecutar la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre. 
					
					Por ultimo, Pak expreso la conviccion de que los paises miembros del Foro Regional de ASEAN enviaran el apoyo y solidaridad a los sinceros esfuerzos de la RPDC por acabar con la circulacion viciosa de agravacion de la tension y lograr la paz duradera y la estabilidad en la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					En adelante tambien, el gobierno de la RPDC hara todo lo posible por desarrollar mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con los paises regionales y preservar la paz y seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana y de la region, segun el ideal de su politica exterior por la independencia, la paz y la amistad, concluyo.

articles.title: Ceremonia de denominacion de Clase Ho Chi Minh
articles.content:
Ceremonia de denominacion de Clase Ho Chi Minh 
						
Pyongyang, 3 de julio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar hoy la ceremonia de denominar la Clase Ho Chi Minh en el Jardin de la Infancia de Kyongsang de Amistad Corea-Vietnam.
					Estuvieron presentes en el acto Kim Jong Suk, presidenta del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, Kim Jin Bom, vicepresidente de susodicho comite y titular de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Vietnam y otros funcionarios, los maestros y ninos del jardin, el embajador Le Quang Ba y otros miembros de la embajada vietnamita en Corea.
					
					Ante todo, los integrantes de la sede diplomatica vietnamita depositaron un cesto de flores ante una obra de bellas artes que describe a los grandes hombres sin iguales del monte Paektu encontrandose con los ninos, colocada en el hall centrico, y les rindieron el homenaje postumo. 
					
					Los oradores senalaron que tenia lugar la ceremonia de denominacion de la Clase Ho Chi Minh en el Jardin de la Infancia de Kyongsang de Amistad Corea-Vietnam en el periodo significativo en que se cumple el 56o aniversario del encuentro del Presidente Kim Il Sung con el presidente del pueblo vietnamita Ho Chi Minh.
					
					Prosiguieron que las relaciones de amistad de los pueblos de ambos paises son una valiosa tradicion preparada por los lideres de la primera generacion en su lucha contra el imperialismo y por la construccion socialista.
					
					Desearon el mayor e incesante desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises.
					
					Seguidamente, los huespedes recorrieron la Clase Ho Chi Minh y la sala de la presentacion del historial, presenciaron la funcion artistica de los ninos y charlaron sobre el tema de intensificar mas la cooperacion y el intercambio en el sector de la educacion y la cultura.
